metadata.job_title: Senior Data Engineer â€“ Commerce Data Pipelines

data_maturity_score.evidence: Modern tech stack with Airflow, Snowflake/Redshift, data quality frameworks, and performance tuning indicates defined processes but contract nature suggests ongoing development

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 3 - documented processes with modern tools, some governance through data quality frameworks

maturity_signals.evidence: Airflow orchestration, Snowflake/Redshift warehouses, and explicit data quality frameworks mentioned

scope_creep_score.evidence: Well-defined data engineering role focused on ETL, modeling, and pipelines - no mention of analytics, ML, or DevOps responsibilities

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Contract role with 'fast-paced environment' mention, 10-month timeline creates pressure, but no explicit overtime requirements

role_clarity.evidence: Focused Senior Data Engineer role with specific ETL, data modeling, and pipeline responsibilities clearly outlined

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk due to contract nature and fast-paced environment, but well-defined scope and modern tech stack are positive

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No mention of reporting structure, manager, or team hierarchy in job description

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No manager level information provided in posting

team_growth_velocity.evidence: Contract role with fixed 10-month duration suggests project-based work rather than team expansion

team_composition.evidence: No team size, composition, or structure information provided in job posting

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: Mentions partnering with 'business, analytics, and infrastructure teams' indicating cross-functional collaboration

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Hybrid model requires 4 days onsite, contract timeline creates pressure, but Friday remote provides some flexibility

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No mention of learning budget, career growth, mentorship, or development opportunities - 10-month contract limits long-term growth

tech_culture_score.evidence: Modern tech stack (Airflow, Snowflake) and focus on data quality indicate good technical practices, but contract nature limits culture assessment

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conferences, hackathons, or innovation time

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: Mentions 'ongoing pipeline monitoring' as responsibility, but no other development practices specified

innovation_signals.evidence: Contract role focused on maintaining and enhancing existing ETL pipelines rather than innovation or new technology exploration

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: Mentions 'build, enhance, and maintain ETL pipelines' and 'performance tuning' suggesting awareness of optimization needs

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of ML, AI, or data science responsibilities - focus is purely on ETL and data warehousing

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML/AI tools mentioned in job requirements or responsibilities

hiring_urgency.evidence: No immediate start date or urgent hiring language mentioned, standard contract hiring process implied

competition_level.evidence: Senior level role with specific technical requirements, hybrid model limits remote candidates, but competitive hourly rate

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Contract role for 'Commerce Data Pipelines' suggests expanding data infrastructure to support business growth

hiring_velocity.evidence: 10-month contract duration indicates project-specific hiring rather than ongoing team expansion

team_size_signals.evidence: No team size information provided in job posting

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No company funding or stage information provided

role_creation_type.evidence: 10-month contract for 'Commerce Data Pipelines' suggests specific project implementation rather than permanent headcount

strength_details: Competitive hourly rate up to $92.5/hr on W2
Modern tech stack with Airflow, Snowflake/Redshift, Python/PySpark
Well-defined Senior Data Engineer role with clear responsibilities
Focus on core data engineering skills without scope creep
concern_details: Only 10-month contract with no conversion to FTE mentioned
No career growth, learning opportunities, or mentorship mentioned
Fast-paced environment and contract timeline suggest potential overtime
Work authorization restricted to GC/USC/EAD (no H1B, OPT, CPT)
best_fit_details: Mid-level data engineers with 3-5 years experience in ETL and warehousing
Engineers with strong SQL and Python/PySpark skills seeking contract work
Professionals comfortable with modern data stack (Airflow, Snowflake/Redshift)
probe_details: Clarify exact scope of ETL work and any potential expansion beyond core responsibilities
Understand expected work hours and any on-call or overtime requirements
Ask about project milestones and what success looks like after 10 months
Inquire about team structure, reporting, and collaboration within the data organization
leverage_details: Strong match for all must-have skills (SQL, ETL, Airflow, Snowflake/Redshift)
Performance tuning and data quality framework experience is valuable for this role
summary.overall_assessment: Solid contract opportunity for mid-level data engineers with modern tech stack and well-defined scope. Competitive compensation but limited to 10 months with no growth opportunities. Best suited for contractors or those seeking short-term, high-impact work. Main trade-offs are contract nature, location restrictions, and lack of long-term career development.
